body:
@bhargav-sudo `--model_path` parameter should point to the model folder with model versions included. You should change it to  `/models/model1`.
Client error indicates that it can't connect to the endpoint. Probably because OVMS was not started with incorrect model path. It could be also confirmed in the ovms container logs.

@dtrawins will try that and let you know
Thanks

@dtrawins and @Mohamad1994HD this is my command to start the docker 

Link : [https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/model_server/blob/main/docs/face_detection_script_example.md](url)

**docker run -d -v $(pwd)/model:/models/model1 -p 9000:9000 openvino/model_server:latest  --model_path /models/model1 --model_name face-detection --port 9000  --shape auto**

There is no problem in preparing model repository
My models were place in same place 
**models/model1/1/facedetection.xml**


My docker exits immediately after execution..

So, I am not able to run client application..
It shows the same error..


But When I worked on this link [https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/model_server/blob/main/docs/ovms_quickstart.md](url)
 It successfully works 
I got the results too.

**what is the difference between these two links..?
and 
What is the difference in these two commands when we are running docker..?**

Thanks..

remove the -d to see the error logs,

you may mount the models directly
```
  -v $(pwd)/model:/models
 --model_path    |/models/model1
```

so what appears inside the docker is /models/model1/1/
and use the model path as  --model_path /models/model1/
so it finds the model versions under the path

But if you mount the model directory as
```
-v $(pwd)/model:/models/model1 then did

--model_path                 |/models/model1
```
The model wouldn't be found ( starting from the | )

I believe the --model_name is just for registering a name to interact with it via a client not for reaching the model file.

This what I found from experimenting with it, please correct me if I got it wrong

@Mohamad1994HD will try and let you know that..
Thanks.

@Mohamad1994HD I removed option -d from the command 

 **docker run -v $(pwd)/model:/models/model1 -p 9000:9000 openvino/model_server:latest --model_path /models/model1 --model_name face-detection --port 9000 --shape auto**

[2021-01-07 16:17:46.285][modelmanager][error][modelmanager.cpp:586] Couldn't list directories in path: /models/model1
[2021-01-07 16:17:46.285][modelmanager][error][modelmanager.cpp:60] Couldn't start model manager
[2021-01-07 16:17:46.285][serving][error][server.cpp:175] ovms::ModelManager::Start() Error: The provided base path is invalid or doesn't exists

It shows this 
what I had to do now..?

let me know ASAP....
Thanks.


This is my model structure 

models (folder)
└── model1 (folder)
    └── 1 (folder)
        ├── age-gender-recognition-retail-0013.bin
        ├── age-gender-recognition-retail-0013.xml
        ├── face-detection-retail-0004.bin
        ├── face-detection-retail-0004.xml
        ├── person-vehicle-bike-detection-crossroad-0078.bin
